Name: Descaled Greater than 20%
Definition: Fish has lost more than 20% of its scales on either side.

Name: Descaled Between 11 and 20%
Definition: Fish has lost between 11% and 20% of its scales on either side.

Name: Possible 0-Aged Chinook
Definition: Fish is possibly a subyearling or zero-age Chinook.

Name: Descaled Greater than 10 Percent
Definition: Fish has lost greater than 10% of its scales on either side.

Name: Descaled Less than 10 Percent
Definition: Fish has lost less than 10% of its scales on either side, but generally more than 3%.

Name: Descaled - Patchy
Definition: Fish has lost scales in patches.

Name: Descaled - Scattered
Definition: Fish has lost scales in areas scattered across the body.

Name: Adipose Fin Clip
Definition: Adipose fin clip present or applied during the current PIT tag event.

Name: Adipose Fin Damage
Definition: Fish has damage to the adipose fin.

Name: Adipose Intact (not clipped)
Definition: Fish has an intact adipose fin; fin has not been removed or clipped.

Name: Adult Lamprey
Definition: Fish is a lamprey that has reached sexual maturity.

Name: Ammocoete Lamprey
Definition: Fish is a juvenile lamprey in the larval stage, which is characterized by the presence of an oral hood and the lack of a sucking disk, teeth and developed eyes.

Name: Anal Fin Damage
Definition: Fish has damage to the anal fin.

Name: Tagged as Adult
Definition: Fish was first marked with a PIT tag as an adult fish during the current PIT tag event.

Name: Bleeding after Tagged
Definition: Fish was observed to be bleeding subsequent to being marked with a PIT tag.

Name: Bloated
Definition: Fish has a bloated appearance.

Name: Brood Stock
Definition: Fish was retained to be used at a hatchery to produce eggs and young.

Name: Body Scars
Definition: Fish has scars on its body.

Name: Bare Tag Recovered after Release
Definition: Bare tag was recovered (e.g. from raceway or separator at juvenile bypass facility) after tagged fish released.

Name: Blank Wire Tag
Definition: Blank coded wire tag present or applied during the current PIT tag event.

Name: Caudal Fin Damage
Definition: Fish has damage to the caudal fin.

Name: Lower Caudal Lobe Clip
Definition: Lower caudal fin clip present or applied during the current PIT tag event.

Name: Coded Wire Tag (Peduncle)
Definition: A coded wire tag in the caudal peduncle either present or applied during the current PIT tag event.

Name: Upper Caudal Lobe Clip
Definition: Upper caudal fin clip present or applied during the current PIT tag event.

Name: Coded Wire Tag
Definition: Coded wire tag present or applied during the current PIT tag event.

Name: Cyst
Definition: Fish has a cyst.

Name: Dropped
Definition: Fish was dropped during PIT-tagging. Fish or tag may be damaged.

Name: Double PIT-tagged
Definition: Fish has been implanted with two PIT tags.

Name: Dorsal Fin Damage
Definition: Fish has damage to the dorsal fin.

Name: Deep Insertion
Definition: PIT tag was implanted more deeply than recommended.

Name: Dark Body Color
Definition: Fish either has dark patches or is entirely darker than expected.

Name: Dis-orbited Eye
Definition: Fish has an eyeball that is no longer contained within the orbit.

Name: Duplicate Tag
Definition: Tag code previously used, needs to be verified as correct and have previous disowned. Often used to explain reason for dotting out a record.

Name: Electro-Shocker Burn
Definition: Fish shows evidence of a burn from being electro-shocked.

Name: Fin Erosion
Definition: Fish shows some distinegration of the fins through bacterial infections in nature, aquaria or aquaculture, aggravated by crowding and nutritional problems in aquaculture tanks.

Name: Elastomer Jet / Photonic Fin Mark
Definition: Fish is marked by a fluorescent plastic tag, visible externally although implanted into clear tissues with a small needle. The tag is liquid but becomes a pliable solid after injection. Often used to identify groups of fish.

Name: Damaged Eye - Left - after Tagging
Definition: Fish has a damaged left eye observed after it was marked with a PIT tag.

Name: Excessive Mucous
Definition: Fish has an increased amount of mucous present on its skin.

Name: Damaged Eye - Right - after Tagging
Definition: Fish has a damaged right eye observed after it was marked with a PIT tag.

Name: Female
Definition: Fish has been sexed as a female. Primarily used when tagging adults.

Name: Fungus
Definition: Fish has some amount of fungus present on its body.

Name: Fish Examination
Definition: Fish was out of water for an unusually long time during examination.

Name: Gas Bubble Trauma
Definition: Fish exhibits signs of gas bubble disease caused by supersaturated gases in water entering the body fluids causing bubbles. Often seen in gills, eyes, skin and yolk sacs where membranes are the most gas permeable.

Name: Grit Mark
Definition: Grit mark present or applied during the current PIT tag event.

Name: Gill Sample
Definition: A tissue sample was taken from the fish's gill.

Name: Hemmorhage
Definition: Hemmorhaging was noted somewhere on the body.

Name: Body Injury - Prior to Tagging
Definition: Fish has an injury to the body, observed before it was marked with a PIT tag.

Name: Immature
Definition: Fish is sexually immature.

Name: Jack
Definition: Fish has become sexually mature after one year in salt water.

Name: Jaw Tagged
Definition: Jaw tag present or applied during current PIT tag event.

Name: Jaw Damage
Definition: Fish has damage to its jaw.

Name: Possible BKD
Definition: Salmonid fish exhibits symptoms consistent with bacterial kidney disease, a slowly progressive systemic infection caused by bacteria.

Name: Kelt
Definition: A spawned out anadromous steelhead trout.

Name: Fish Lost/Rejected Tag before Release
Definition: Tag was shed or rejected from fish after tagging but before it was released (for example, tag was found in the recovery tank after fish were relesed post-tagging). Often used a reason for dotting out a record.

Name: Lacerations
Definition: Fish has cuts on its body.

Name: Large Fish Flume from Separator
Definition: Fish was collected from the flume exiting the large fish section of a separator that sorts fish by size.

Name: Left Pectoral Fin Ray Sample
Definition: A tissue sample was taken from the left pectoral fin ray.

Name: Light Body Color
Definition: Fish has light-colored patches or is entirely lighter in color than expected.

Name: Left Ventral Fin Clip
Definition: Left ventral fin clip present or applied during current PIT tag event.

Name: Mortality
Definition: A previously PIT tagged fish has been recovered post-mortem.

Name: Male
Definition: Fish has been sexed as a male.  Primarily used when tagging adults.

Name: Bleeding at Tagging/Died Pre-Release
Definition: Fish was bleeding when it was tagged and died after tagging, but before release.

Name: Minijack
Definition: Fish has become sexually mature after no winters in saltwater.

Name: Removed from Release Group (Killed)
Definition: Fish was intentionally removed from the release group population and killed prior to release.

Name: Left Maxillary Clip
Definition: Left maxillary clip present or applied during current PIT tag event.

Name: Macrophthalmia Lamprey
Definition: Lamprey in the juvenile phase between ammocoete and adult. Sucker disk and eyes present.

Name: Right Maxillary Clip
Definition: Right maxillary clip present or applied during current PIT tag event.

Name: Sample Mort (Intentional Sacrifice)
Definition: Fish was killed as part of a sample.

Name: Mature
Definition: Fish is sexually mature.

Name: Non-Functional Tag also in Fish
Definition: Fish has a non-functional PIT tag implanted along with a functional tag.

Name: No Mucous
Definition: Fish has no mucous present on its skin.

Name: Opercule Damage
Definition: Fish has damage to the opercule.

Name: Parasite
Definition: Fish has a visible parasite.

Name: Previously Branded
Definition: Fish was branded before the current handling event.

Name: Poor Fin Clip
Definition: Fish has an incomplete or poorly completed fin clip; the fin that is poorly clipped will be specified with another flag code (e.g. LV = Left Ventral Fin Clip).

Name: Peterson Disc
Definition: Fish has Peterson disc tag present or applied during current PIT tag event.

Name: Passive Observation
Definition: Passive recapture. A previously PIT-tagged fish is opportunistically detected, but not handled, subsequent to the mark event.

Name: Precocious
Definition: Fish has matured quickly or faster than other fish of its age-class. Often used for matured male parr or smolts.

Name: Pectoral Fin Damage
Definition: Fish has damage to the pectoral fin.

Name: Pelvic Fin Damage
Definition: Fish has damage to the pelvic fin.

Name: Complete and Legible Freeze Brand
Definition: Complete and Legible Freeze Brand

Name: Brand is Legible but Incomplete
Definition: Freeze brand is legible but incomplete

Name: Brand is not Legible
Definition: Freeze brand is not legible

Name: Brand Rotation or Position Wrong
Definition: Freeze brand rotation or position wrong

Name: No Brand
Definition: No freeze brand is present

Name: Brand Caused Light to Excessive Burn
Definition: Freeze brand caused light to excessive burn

Name: Recapture
Definition: A previously PIT-tagged fish is recaptured, handled, and re-released subsequent to the mark event.

Name: Returning Fish
Definition: Fish has returned from the ocean and is migrating upstream at the time of the event.

Name: Right Pectoral Fin Ray Sample
Definition: Tissue sample taken from the right pectoral fin ray.

Name: Radio Tagged
Definition: Radio tag present or applied during the current PIT tag event.

Name: Right Ventral Fin Clip
Definition: Right ventral fin clip present or applied during current PIT tag event.

Name: Scoliosis
Definition: Fish has scoliosis.

Name: Small Fish Flume from Separator
Definition: Fish was collected from the flume exiting the small fish section of a separator that sorts fish by size.

Name: Sonic (Acoustic) Tag Implant
Definition: Acoustic tag present or applied during the current PIT tag event.

Name: Subsequent Mort
Definition: Fish died as a result of some activity other than tagging (e.g., gill clip, scale collection, etc.).

Name: Spaghetti Tag
Definition: Spaghetti tag present or applied during the current PIT tag event.

Name: Streamer Tag
Definition: Streamer tag present or applied duirng the current PIT tag event.

Name: Surgery
Definition: Surgery was performed on the fish.

Name: Silvery Body Color
Definition: Fish has silvery body color.

Name: Anchor (T-bar) Tag
Definition: T-bar or other anchor tag present or applied during the current PIT tag event.

Name: Tagged In Muscle
Definition: PIT tag was inadvertently implanted into the muscle instead of the abdominal cavity.

Name: Ulcer
Definition: The fish has an open eruption or sore on its body.

Name: Visual Implant / Eye Adipose
Definition: Visual eye implant (with text, not elastomer) present or applied during the current PIT tag event.

Name: Possible Whirling Disease
Definition: Fish exhibits symptoms of whirling disease.

Name: Duplicate Tag for Pre-Release Mort
Definition: Archaic. Was used to indicate the original fish tagged with this code died before release and the tag was reused in another fish.

Name: Possible Age One (Yearling)
Definition: Fish appears to be a yearling, but it is not certain.
